page.title: 01Summary Of Landscape.
page.content: This area is east of St Ives and is rural.It lies in a shallow valley only 10m above sealevel with the River Ouse running through it.Gravel pits & rough pasture lie close to the river. There are many naturalised large ponds formed from old gravel pit workings.Further away, the land is mostly cultivated with arable crops.To the west are the outskirts of St Ives, including a light industrial area. The 9th century village of Holywell is close to the river.Needingworth is to the north of Holywell and is astride the A1123.In Needingworth there is a primary school,a garage,2 food shops,a fish farm and a hairdresser's.Farming activities include 3 poultry farms, 4 arable farms and some orchards.The area is served by 5 public houses and 2 churches.
